tenaska.name: Tenaska
tenaska.title: Software Developer
tenaska.p1: Working in an Agile team of 5 to develop a web-application for monitoring Tenaska's natrual gas pipelines
tenaska.p2: Created multiple user-friendly UI components for the application in React.js using Scss and the MUI react library
tenaska.p3: Connected front end data table to backend API to regularly pull time-sensitive data from > 40 pipelines

pfg.name: Principal Financial Group
pfg.title: Software Engineering Intern
pfg.p1: Worked in an Agile team of ~15 developers developing applications to onboard and update > 75,000 active client retirement plans.
pfg.p2: Engineered the front-end interface for multiple React/Typescript/Scss web applications and gained experience in AWS lambda.
pfg.p3: Prod-deployed > 5,000 new lines of code; maintained multiple Java/Spring REST apis which connected to a SQL database.

hudl.name: Hudl
hudl.title: Software Development Intern - Design Studio
hudl.p1: Produced an extension of Hudl Assist specifically for field hockey, collaborating with an agile team of six.
hudl.p2: Developed and implemented logic in C# to document shot attempts and related statistics for coach and team analysis.
hudl.p3: Engineered the front-end interface for selecting multiple game events, such as shots and passes using React and TypeScript.

raikes.name: the Raikes School @ UNL
raikes.title: Computer Science Teaching Assistant
raikes.p1: Instruct 40 Raikes Honors CS students through TA hours, labs, and lectures. Review/grade assignments, tests, and labs.
raikes.p2: Expanded knowledge of: Java, SQL, OOP, algorithms, data structures, discrete math, relations, the terminal, and GUIs.

collins.name: Collins Engineers
collins.title: IT Intern
collins.p1: Engineered an optimized system for onboarding and offboarding all company employees utilizing Powershell and JS scripts.
collins.p2: Customized automated HR and IT messages used in the onboarding and offboarding processes using HTML and CSS.

unl.title: University of Nebraska - Lincoln
unl.p1: Bachelor of Science, Computer Science | Minors: Business Administration, Math | GPA: 4.00/4.00
unl.p2: Jeffrey S. Raikes School of Computer Science and Management: The Raikes School is a highly competitive computer science and business honors program at UNL which accepts 40 students a year.

pegsAndJokers.title: Pegs & Jokers
pegsAndJokers.p1: Developed a multiplayer web browser game in React.js where users can play the board game with up to three other players.
pegsAndJokers.p2: Engineered game logic to validate all player moves in Java, utilizing the Spring Boot framework with an MVC architecture.
pegsAndJokers.p3: Built real-time game lobbies using Socket.IO; integrated custom user profiles with Firebase; designed an intuitive UI in CSS.

plResource.title: Premier League Resource
plResource.p1: Created a full-stack web app in React/TypeScript that displays EPL soccer information such as a team’s matches and stats.
plResource.p2: Developed backend using Python, BeautifulSoup, and Flask to scrape information for >1,000 player stats and >700 matches.
plResource.p3: Designed a complete UI that resembles the English Premier League’s own style and aesthetic using SCSS.
plResource.p4: Hosted the frontend on Firebase; created a Docker container for the backend Flask app and hosted that using AWS Lightsail.

portfolio.title: Portfolio
portfolio.p1: The website that you are currently looking at!
portfolio.p2: Developed a React.js/TypeScript application that dynamically displays my portfolio information; hosted using Firebase.
portfolio.p3: Designed a variety of UI components from scratch using SCSS.
